Race.SpecificTitle: PW Prop. No. 1 -- 1.18 Mills Rededication - PJ - 4 Yrs. Ext.
Race.FullText: Shall one-half of the proceeds of the one and eighteen hundredths (1.18) mills property tax heretofore collected and not expended and hereinafter collected, which is presently authorized to be levied by the Parish of Madison, State of Louisiana (the "Parish"), through the year 2022 for Public Health Unit purposes pursuant to an election held on April 30, 2011 (an estimated $132,160 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), be rededicated for the purpose of supporting the general fund and shall the Parish be further authorized to extend the levy of said 1.18 mills property tax for an additional period of four (4) years through the year 2026?

Race.SpecificTitle: PW Prop. No. 2 -- 9.03 Mills Rededication - PJ - 8 Yrs. Ext.
Race.FullText: Shall the proceeds of the nine and three hundredths (9.03) mills property tax heretofore collected and not expended and hereinafter collected, which is presently authorized to be levied by the Parish of Madison, State of Louisiana (the "Parish"), through the year 2018 for Courthouse and Jail and Solid Waste purposes pursuant to an election held on July 19, 2008 (an estimated $1,011,360 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), be rededicated such that the proceeds will be allocated as follows: 50% for providing and maintaining garbage collection and disposal services and 50% for constructing, improving, equipping, operating and maintaining public works and roads of the Parish, and shall the Parish be further authorized to extend the levy of said 9.03 mills property tax for an additional period of eight (8) years through the year 2026?

Race.SpecificTitle: City of Tallulah -- 15 Mills & .5% S&U - CC - 20 Yrs.
Race.FullText: Shall the City of Tallulah, State of Louisiana ("City"), pursuant to Article VI, Section 27 and 29 of the Louisiana Constitution of 1974, and other authority, be authorized to levy and collect (i) a special tax of fifteen (15.00) mills on all property subject to taxation in the City (an estimated $210,000 reasonably expected to be collected from said levy for an entire year), and (ii) a sales and use tax of one-half of one percent (.5%) upon the sale at retail, the use, the lease or rental, the consumption, and the storage for use or consumption, of tangible personal property and on sales of services in the City, all as presently defined in La. R.S. 47:301 et seq. (an estimated $317,000 reasonably expected to be collected from said levy for an entire year), the proceeds of which may be pledged for bonds, both for a period of twenty (20) years, beginning with the year 2017 (April 1, 2017 for the sales tax), with proceeds to be dedicated and used for purposes of (i) providing additional support to the City's Police Department; (ii) constructing, improving and maintaining streets; (iii) recreation; and (iv) capital expenditures in the City?
